description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the hypervisor-protected code integrity (HVCI) security feature bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-21431), apply the following updates:

1. Visit the Microsoft Update Catalog using the links provided.
2. Download and install the relevant KB articles for your version of Windows:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
   - For 32-bit systems of Windows 10 Version 22H2 and 21H2, use [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845).
3. Restart your system after installation to ensure that the updates take effect.

**Details**:
This series of updates addresses the bypass issue related to the hypervisor-protected code integrity feature, ensuring that system integrity is maintained. It is crucial to perform these updates to protect against this important security concern.
**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running an affected version of Windows as listed in the update references.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
